page.title: 11Getting around N.Upottery
page.content: Our nearest shopping town is Honiton,and for this we give each other lifts,since there is no satisfactory bus-service.Twice a week a private bus firm runs a service into and out of Taunton and there is a daily post-bus that runs through the village.The latter is of little use,since we are its first port of call before a long,long string of villages on its meandering course back to Honiton.Private transport is essential if you live in this area. The main lanes are well kept,though they can be perilously narrow ,winding or steep;we are all extremely courteous to each other about backing to the nearest field entrance when we meet face to face.Especially when one of us is a milk tanker or a large piece of farm machinery!And we have the frequent problem of fog.
